newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine consumer inflation 0.2 pct in July.
newsitem.headline: Argentine consumer inflation 0.2 pct in July.

text.p: Argentine consumer prices rose 0.2 percent in July compared with 0.5 percent in July last year and a 0.2 percent rise in June this year, the Economy Ministry said Monday.
Wholesale prices dropped 0.4 percent in July, compared with an 0.1 percent decline in July 1996 and a 0.4 percent decline a month earlier.
Annualized consumer inflation in July was 0.6 percent, compared with zero inflation in July last year. There was accumulated deflation of 0.1 percent in the first seven months of the year.
For wholesale prices, July showed annualized deflation of 0.4 percent, while there were accumulated wholesale price declines of 0.8 percent in the first seven months of the year.
Analysts polled by Reuters had predicted consumer prices would rise 0.2 percent in the month.
